intro: Gastonia rodriguesiana, commonly known as Rodrigues's hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and is often found in moist, shaded environments. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to several meters in height. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
